detaileddescription.para: Connect here to receive value changes.
Connect here to receive information on type "change" (usually type discovery).
Reference to a RootProxy object that links back to the original tree.
Cached information on the remote value.
We have sent a notification out and the reply has not come back yet, we need to slow down in order to avoid flooding.
We have sent a notification out and the reply has not come back yet, we need to slow down in order to avoid flooding.
Class signature.
This method should be called to set a new value for the 'real' remote object. It is usually called by some GUI widget callback when the user changes a control.

This is the operation executed when the object is called. In order to benefit from return value optimization and avoid too many copy you have to use Value v = xxx.trigger(val). Todo
why is the return value const ?
This method should be implemented in order to give a visual feedback to users that the value has changed (GUI object notification).
This method is called when the object proxy receives it's type information or the type of the remote changed.
Find the list of children by querying the remote.
If root is a RootProxy, set root_proxy_ as well. You can overwrite this (but make sure to call ObjectProxy::adopted() in your method). This method is called when the object is adopted.
Returns true if the object has been properly initialized (type and value have been synced with remote).
Dynamically build a child from the given name. This method is called whenever a sub-node or branch is not found and this is the last found object along the path.
"Current" time relative to this object's creation.
Measured network latency between action and reply.
Connect here to receive value changes.
Connect here to receive information on type "change" (usually type discovery).
If the first message (get current value) was lost, the proxy won't send any new messages. This command resets the state of the connection.
This class helps maintain a 'ghost' object that mirrors a remote 'real' object. It is usually used as an element from an interface to interact with the remote object.
This object is not fully functional before the root_proxy has been set (when adopted by a RootProxy).
